title: Online Car Seller Vroom Files Confidentially for IPO
summary: Firm sets sights on a June offering after rich funding round. Online used-car seller Vroom Inc. has filed confidentially for an initial public offering it hopes to stage in June, according to people familiar with its plans, a move that will test the ice-cold tech IPO market.

title: New York Legislators Look to Washington, and Maybe to Taxes
summary: Coronavirus crisis has hit state finances hard, with revenues falling $13.3 billion short of level projected in February. Leaders of the New York state Legislature say they are waiting to see what Congress does before they develop plans for their own lawmaking session. And they said tax hikes are on the table if additional aid to deal with the coronavirus pandemic isn't forthcoming from Washington.

title: Colombia's Avianca Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Latin America's second-largest airline seeks chapter 11 protection in New York. Colombian airline Avianca Holdings SA filed for bankruptcy protection in the U.S. as travel restrictions curtail flights and the company vies for public assistance from the Colombian and other governments to endure the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Barack Obama on Michael Flynn
summary: The lawyer President misstates the crime and the real threat to justice.. Barack Obama is a lawyer, so it was stunning to read that he ventured into the Michael Flynn case in a way that misstated the supposed crime and ignored the history of his own Administration in targeting Mr. Flynn. Since the former President chose to offer his legal views when he didn't need to, we wonder what he's really worried about.

title: Some Americans Are Being Turned Away Trying to Buy Life Insurance
summary: Certain buyers moved quickly to purchase policies before they became tougher to get last month. U.S. insurers are doing the once unthinkable, turning away business from some Americans who want a life-insurance policy.

title: The Chief Justice Quashes a Political Stunt
summary: Roberts says there's no basis for a liberal smear against a retiring judge.. The Democratic campaign to delegitimize conservative judges goes beyond Senate threats to restructure the Supreme Court. Consider the progressive stunt that Chief Justice John Roberts put to bed Friday.

title: More Covid-19 Patient Data, Please
summary: New York finds some surprising results about those who test positive.. President Trump said last week that he plans to refocus the White House coronavirus task force on reopening the economy, and one area that deserves more attention is data collection. More states are starting to gather information on the underlying health conditions of people who get sick with coronavirus. That will help doctors identify and treat high-risk patients, but information on the habits of infected individuals will also be important to guide reopening plans.

title: More Trouble Looms for Hong Kong
summary: China denounces the protest movement as a 'political virus.'. Hong Kong's political health took a turn for the worse last week, even as the city celebrated progress in its containment of coronavirus. Beijing knows that the rest of the world is distracted with the pandemic, and it is exploiting the opportunity to exert more control in Hong Kong.

title: U.S. Drafts Guidelines for Reopening Nursing Homes
summary: An early draft of the recommendations has raised concerns among industry officials and experts that elderly residents could face even higher risks of infection. Federal health regulators are developing guidelines for reopening nursing homes, according to people with knowledge of the matter, proposing steps that would allow visitors to return to facilities that have been hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic despite lockdowns.

title: The U.S. Post Office Remains a Vital Service
summary: The Postal Service binds this nation together and its intricate network of deliveries is a national treasure.. In "Phase Out, Don't Bail Out, the Post Office" (op-ed, May 6), Gary MacDougal ignores the essential public service function of the United States Postal Service.

title: PBS Defends Its Norman Borlaug Portrayal
summary: Our film presents a nuanced portrait of a scientist who saved millions of lives, but whose innovations have had some unintended consequences in the long term.. Your editorial "Battering Norman Borlaug" (April 25) mischaracterizes our documentary on Norman Borlaug, "The Man Who Tried to Feed the World." Far from "battering" the Nobel Peace Prize-winning agronomist, the film credits Borlaug for largely banishing the specter of global famine in the late 1960s. "It seemed almost miraculous," the narrator says, "and Borlaug had been at the center of it."

title: Protect Beef Workers With Real Rules, Not 'Guidance'
summary: OSHA must not just recommend these things, but order them. It is their job to protect the workers from companies that don't follow that guidance.. Your editorial "Trump's Beef Stakes" (April 30) indicates that the "order offers liability protections to companies that protect workers by following in good faith the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Labor Department safety and health guidance."

title: Biden Is Hurt by #MeToo's Ideology-Driven Methods
summary: William McGurn calls attention to the "inconsistencies [that] are dividing the #MeToo side between folks who remain true to the old standard and those who have modified it because they don't want to bring down Mr. Biden.". William McGurn's "Al Franken's Revenge" (Main Street, May 5) calls attention to the "inconsistencies [that] are dividing the #MeToo side between folks who remain true to the old standard and those who have modified it because they don't want to bring down Mr. Biden." But the problem with the #MeToo movement isn't just inconsistency. It's that the old "believe women" standard was so outrageous that it's astonishing that anyone ever endorsed it at all.

title: Boris Johnson Unveils Plan to Ease U.K. Lockdown
summary: British leader says nation's lifting of restrictions will be gradual and could be reversed. British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said the U.K. would take some small steps this week in easing the lockdown he put in place seven weeks ago but made clear that Britons faced a slow and uncertain walk out of quarantine.

title: Higher Ed's Coronavirus Opportunity
summary: Don't treat the shutdown as a temporary problem. Seize it as a chance to pursue innovation.. Deciding where to enroll in college always induces anxiety in high-school seniors and their families. This year, the decision is even more uncertain. The purpose of a college education has come into question in recent years, and the coronavirus pandemic has made it unclear what the college experience will be like come September.

title: Who Needs Oil When Even OPEC Telecommutes?
summary: Changes wrought by the pandemic could dampen global demand for years and kill American shale.. Dhahran, Saudi Arabia

title: Democrats Protect Lives, With a Big Exception
summary: The 'elective' procedure blue-state politicians wouldn't halt for the coronavirus pandemic.. Battle lines are being drawn over when and how to reopen the economy. These are hard decisions-the kind politicians prefer to avoid-because they're both uncertain and consequential. Yet you can tell people's true character in a crisis-what is most important, what they're willing to fight for.

title: Notable & Quotable: Nate Silver
summary: 'Not providing context on the increase in testing is such a basic error.'. FiveThirtyEight.com's Nate Silver writing on Twitter , May 7:

title: How Cuba's Spies Keep Winning
summary: They've infiltrated another attempt to unseat Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro.. The failed landing on a rugged stretch of Venezuelan coastline last week by a band of mercenaries hoping to unseat Venezuelan dictator Nicolás Maduro is another tragedy for the beleaguered nation.

title: Graduation Is a Time for Unlearning
summary: You're now free from empty campus dogma, so seize the chance to try out better ideas.. Dear grads, lockdown class of 2020: Switch off "Animal Crossing," wrap up that episode of "The Masked Singer," pause practicing your TikTok "Renegade" dance, finish ironically chugging your Corona beer, and listen up-Karens, Beckys and Chads, too.

title: 'Bezonomics' Review: Spinning the Flywheel
summary: How Amazon and its 'one in a billion' chief executive, through various ventures, envelop customers in the company's ecosystem.. Long ago, I worked at a magazine that put the chief executives of America's five best-managed companies on its cover each December. Wall Street analysts eagerly awaited our annual feature, but not for the intended reason. Very often, a corporate boss who basked in our praise soon found short sellers on his trail.

title: Economy Week Ahead: Inflation, GDP, Retail Sales
summary: Lockdowns, restrictions are expected to continue rippling through the world's economies. Economic data out this week will again reflect the impact of the coronavirus.

title: Despite Recent Bets, Fed Isn't Likely to Consider Negative Interest Rates
summary: Futures markets suggest investors think the central bank could implement a policy experiment that officials prefer to avoid. Federal Reserve officials are unlikely to consider using negative interest rates to stimulate economic growth in the current coronavirus-induced downturn after concluding the tool's clear costs outweigh its uncertain benefits.

title: Antibody Knowledge Can Be Power
summary: Reliable tests are replacing questionable ones from China. The results can help Americans judge risk.. Covid-19 may be here for a long time. As work and activities begin to resume, there will continue to be risk and many new precautions. But for people who were exposed to the virus and recovered, the risk is much lower. Knowing if you had the infection and recovered will soon take on added importance.

title: I Knew Little Richard as Mr. Penniman
summary: He worked in a bus station's kitchen in the 1950s when inspiration struck.. Whenever our paths would cross, I would address him as Mr. Penniman. Respect for your elders and all that, but what the heck else were you supposed to call him? "Hello, Little?" "Hello, Richard?" "Hello, Little Richard?" So Mr. Penniman it was, and he never objected or corrected.

title: South Korea's Early Coronavirus Wins Dim After Rash of New Cases
summary: More than 50 cases have been linked to Seoul's nightclubs and bars, which have now been ordered closed. SEOUL-South Korea, which largely succeeded in quelling the initial spread of the coronavirus, is back on the defensive, with Seoul's bars and clubs ordered closed, as the country reported its biggest one-day increase in new infections in a month.

title: Big Investment Firms Take Lead in Stimulus Program
summary: Resume Subscription. The Federal Reserve's giant program of corporate bond buying is about to kick in. It will hand a critical new role in propping the struggling economy to a business with increasing clout in the financial world: money management.

title: U.S. Falling Short on Needed Contact Tracers, Experts Say
summary: Officials say they don't know who will fund or provide needed resources and worry they will lose government workers temporarily assigned to fill shortage. When the coronavirus pandemic hit the U.S. in March, George Roberts, chief executive of the Northeast Texas Public Health District, set his three contact tracers to work tracking everyone who had been close to infected people.

title: Justice Clarence Thomas Finds His Voice
summary: The long-silent jurist makes some noise as Supreme Court shifts to teleconference arguments. WASHINGTON-Justice Clarence Thomas's years of silence during the Supreme Court's oral arguments have left him hidden in plain sight, but his emergence during the court's telephonic hearings served notice that he remains an active, if idiosyncratic, participant in the court's deliberations.

title: Indian and Chinese Troops in Standoff at Disputed Border
summary: India says scores of soldiers from both sides exchanged words, blows at pass in northeastern Sikkim state. NEW DELHI-Indian and Chinese security forces scuffled along the disputed border between the two Asian giants, injuring soldiers on both sides, Indian officials said Sunday.

title: A Nation of Zombie Borrowers Isn't Inevitable
summary: Governments and central banks are correct in trying to extend credit to companies that were already loaded up. Can you cure a debt problem with more debt?

title: Republicans Try to Put Biden on Defense Over Assault Claim
summary: Allies of Trump have generally not sided with Tara Reade but say that they are pointing out inconsistencies on the part of Democrats. President Trump's campaign and Republican allies are accusing Democrats of employing a double standard in sticking by Joe Biden following an allegation of sexual assault, after Democrats called for an FBI investigation and asked tough questions in a hearing about an assault claim against Mr. Trump's 2018 Supreme Court pick.

title: Iron Man or Black Widow vs. the Coronavirus? Discuss.
summary: And Harry Potter has a spell to try. Fan fiction puts popular heroes at the center of the fight against the pandemic; Pop-Tarts and beer for Thor on lockdown. Peter Parker-Spider-Man out of costume-pleads for his Aunt May to stay home, safe from the coronavirus infection.

title: Venezuela Invasion Was Doomed to Fail
summary: Force that sought President Maduro's overthrow trained with broomsticks for rifles, was infiltrated by agents, had scarce food, and was underfunded. Bogotá, Colombia-As a top Venezuelan army general, Clíver Alcalá helped to prepare the country for a widely feared foreign invasion. But after breaking with the Socialist regime, he fled here to Colombia and planned last weekend's botched raid on his homeland that was supposed to pierce the very defenses he had set up.

title: How to Start a Garden-With Very Little Effort
summary: The 'newspaper trick' can save you blisters and back pain. Millions of people are turning to their yards for recreation as the pandemic limits other options, and gardening is one of the big winners.

title: '90 Day Fiancé' Rides the Lockdown Wave-Why Viewers Can't Stop Watching
summary: TLC's sprawling franchise is riding high in the ratings and includes an interconnected network of shows including a 'Self-Quarantined' edition.. Colt Johnson is a world-famous bachelor who lives with his mother and six cats.

title: MLB Takes Aim at a Plan to Play Ball in 2020
summary: The league is expected to present a formal proposal to the players' union this week after commissioner Rob Manfred holds a call with owners. American professional sports have been shut down for two months because of the coronavirus pandemic, but Major League Baseball is about to get serious about finding a way back to the field.

title: Coronavirus Unravels Private-Equity Playbook for Some Retailers
summary: Many retail chains backed by buyout firms were struggling even before the pandemic forced store closures. J.Crew Group Inc., owned by two private-equity firms, filed for bankruptcy on Monday.

title: Coronavirus Downturn Versus Great Depression
summary: Today's downturn is comparable in scale to that of the 1930s, but it probably won't be as damaging or long-lasting, economists say. News stories often describe the coronavirus-induced global economic downturn as the worst since the Great Depression.

title: How to Take Better Breaks From Your Screens
summary: Feeling burned out from too much screen time? Try the Pomodoro technique, use voice-to-text dictation, and opt for audio workouts instead of Zoom classes.. Going from a day in front of your computer to a Zoom happy hour to a family Netflix binge session can leave you feeling more exhausted than fulfilled. The solution seems obvious: Spend less time with your devices, duh. But that's not as simple as putting down your phone, especially during the coronavirus quarantine, when they're our primary venues for work and play.

title: Waste Management Wants Consumers to Pay More as It Moves More Trash
summary: Working from home, Americans produce more household waste, resulting in higher costs for trash haulers. Devina Rankin wants to charge cities and towns more to pick up their trash and recyclables, since Americans working from home are producing more waste-and it costs more to get rid of it.

title: Meet the Woman Who Made Netflix's 'Tiger King' Must-See Quarantine TV
summary: The streaming-video giant's Lisa Nishimura explains why documentary storytelling is booming, describes taking film pitches via Zoom. Lisa Nishimura's job is to be on the lookout for the unusual story that even the Hollywood fantasy machines can't make up.

title: Older Europeans Reject Calls to Remain in Isolation
summary: Resume Subscription. PARIS-Older generations across Europe are resisting pressure to remain isolated from the rest of society as countries begin to reopen their economies and brace for the possibility of a resurgence in coronavirus infections.

title: Tesla Files Suit to Reopen Fremont Factory
summary: Elon Musk says he is ready to abandon California as the electric-car company's home. Tesla Inc. has asked a federal judge to allow the electric-car maker to reopen its lone U.S. assembly factory, calling a local government's insistence that it remain closed to fight the spread of Covid-19 a power grab that defies the U.S. Constitution.

title: On Long Runs, She Plans for Her Company's Long Run
summary: Resume Subscription. Kelly Grier has always used her runs as thinking time. These days, the Ernst & Young senior executive has a lot to think about. "It's an extraordinary time to be a leader," she says. "I have more than 80,000 people relying on me."

title: Coronavirus-Hit Emirates Forecasts More Than a Year of Travel Disruptions
summary: Results show impact on Persian Gulf carriers and signal the wallop still awaiting region's economies. International air travel will take at least 18 months to recover, Emirates Airline said Sunday, as the coronavirus pandemic contributed to a collapse in annual net profits at the carrier's parent.

title: Photos of the Week
summary: Viral video leads to arrests in killing of Ahmaud Arbery, world remembers 75th anniversary of V-E Day, Hong Kong lawmakers' meeting erupts and more. "There's stigmatization of health-care workers in the community. I think we've come a long way from the hysteria, and the heightened fear, and the anxiety about the infection spread. But for the health-care workers, obviously like myself, going to a grocery store in scrubs, there's this fear." -Linet Ngete, 39, Seattle. Read more.

title: Should Mild Coronavirus Cases Isolate at Home? Many Asian Countries Say No
summary: Practice differs from much of West, where those who don't need hospital care are asked to stay in their houses. Across swaths of Asia, from China's coronavirus epicenter of Wuhan to Singapore and South Korea, the well-known strategies of tracing and testing have worked in tandem with a third big logistical task: isolating mild cases outside their homes.

title: Republicans Look to Win Back House Seat in California Special Election
summary: Former fighter pilot Mike Garcia squares off against state assemblywoman Christy Smith in contest on Tuesday that will be prominent test of mail-in voting. WASHINGTON-Republicans have a chance to pick up a House seat in a special election in California this week, in a race that will test the uncertain dynamics of mail-in voting headed into its broader use this fall due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: America's Smallest Stocks Are Staging a Comeback
summary: Rally stands in contrast to economic data showing unprecedented job losses. Shares of small U.S. companies are racing higher, stirring a debate among investors about how much longer the stock market can keep rallying despite some of the grimmest economic news since the Great Depression.

title: Nearly a Third of Kentucky Workers Seek Jobless Aid
summary: With the governor's encouragement, the Bluegrass State has the highest rate of unemployment filing in the nation. Nearly a third of Kentucky's labor force has filed for unemployment insurance, the largest share of any U.S. state, partly reflecting officials' encouragement to do so and an early move to expand workers' eligibility.

title: Global Virus Cases Top 4 Million as U.S. Moves to Boost Tests
summary: New York is opening 22 new sites in low-income areas, while Delaware, Connecticut announce testing expansions. State leaders across the U.S. moved to expand testing for the new coronavirus, while lifting some restrictions on travel and business that have crippled the nation's economy.
